title: Latitude signs eight retailers to BNPL as float pitch ramps up
text:
Sharemarket-hopeful Latitude Financial Group is doing its best to transform into a digital payments company right in front of potential investors' eyes.

As Latitude and its big broker syndicate seek to drum up support for a mooted $1.25 billion to $1.4 billion initial public offering, the company has its sales team signing up retailers to join its new LatitudePay digital payments platform.

Latitude is expected to tell brokers and potential investors eight retailers have agreed to join the likes of Harvey Norman and The Good Guys in offering LatitudePay to customers.

Latitude Financial Group CEO Ahmed Fahour flies out to meet offshore fund managers ahead of his company's attempted float. Photo: Alex Ellinghausen

The retailers include bed seller Forty Winks, jewellers Prouds, Angus & Coote and Goldmark, and electronics retailer Bing Lee.

LatitudePay is the company's new buy-now-pay-later platform and lets shoppers pay for purchases in 10 weekly instalments on an interest free basis.
description: Sharemarket hopeful Latitude is doing its best to transform into a digital payments company.
